com.ashwin.fri.pacman.actor

Class Ghost

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ashwin.fri.pacman.actor.Actor
      • com.ashwin.fri.pacman.actor.Ghost
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Blinky, Clyde, Inky, Pinky

    public abstract class Ghost
extends Actor
    Ghosts are a particular kind of actors that move without any human input. They use a very simple form of artificial intelligence to determine where to move next. Each time a ghost enters a new tile, it computes a new target tile based on some determined algorithm. Then it moves toward that tile and repeats the process over again.
    Author:
    ashwin

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Terrain terrain)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Returns whether or not the actor can move through the specified terrain. By default, actors can only move through passable terrain. However, under certain circumstances actors can move through impassable terrain (ex. gates)
        Overrides:
        canMove in class Actor
        Returns:
        whether or not the actor can move through the terrain

      • move

        public boolean move(java.util.List<Actor> actors,
           Grid grid)
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Moves the actor to its next location in the grid. The next position is specified by the getNextPosition method. The method returns true if the actor's position was changed by the move and false otherwise.
        Overrides:
        move in class Actor
        Returns:
        whether or not the actor could move

      • getChaseDuration

        public int getChaseDuration()
        The number of milliseconds that the chase states lasts. The higher the difficulty, the longer the chase state will last.
        Returns:
        millisecond duration of chase state

      • getScatterDuration

        public int getScatterDuration()
        The number of milliseconds that the scatter state lasts. The higher the difficulty, the shorter the scatter state will last.
        Returns:
        millisecond duration of scatter state

      • getIdleDuration

        public abstract int getIdleDuration()
        The number of milliseconds that the idles state lasts. The idle state duration is independent of difficulty. Certain ghosts will always take longer to appear than other ghosts no matter the difficulty.
        Returns:
        millisecond duration of the idle state

      • getNextOrientation

        public Actor.Orientation getNextOrientation(java.util.List<Actor> actors,
                                   Grid grid)
        The Ghost AI uses a simple targeting mechanism to determine which direction to move in. Each ghost implementation performs chase targeting differently, but all other ghosts have the same targeting mechanism in the other states.
        Specified by:
        getNextOrientation in class Actor
        Parameters:
        grid - current grid
        point - point to move to
        Returns:
        target orientation

      • getMode

        public Ghost.Mode getMode()
        The current state that the ghost is in. The way that the ghost moves and the way that PacMan interacts with ghosts is largely dependent on the state that the ghost is in. Note: The original PacMan also includes a SCATTER state which I did not include for simplicity's sake.
        Returns:
        current state of the ghost

      • setMode

        public void setMode(Ghost.Mode mode)

      • getExitPosition

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getExitPosition()
        The exit position represents the exit location for ghosts in the ghost pen. This position is used as a fixed target to help ghosts exit.
        Returns:
        exit position

      • getScatterPosition

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getScatterPosition()
        The scatter position represents the scatter location for ghosts in the ghost pen. This position is used as a fixed target to help ghosts scatter.
        Returns:
        scatter position

      • getSprite

        public AnimatedSprite getSprite()
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Returns the default sprite for this Actor. Subclasses can override the default behavior to implement different sprites for different states.
        Overrides:
        getSprite in class Actor
        Returns:
        default sprite
